name: jira
description: MCP server for Jira project management. Creates issues across types (epics, stories, tasks, bugs), sets priorities, links dependencies, assigns sprints, and manages boards. Used by the Integration Planner to export the full project plan into a Jira project.

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Create a Jira issue with type (epic, story, task, bug, subtask), summary, description, priority, and story points

tools.name: update_issue
tools.description: Update an existing issue's fields (status, assignee, priority, sprint, labels)

tools.name: create_issue_link
tools.description: Link two issues with a dependency type (blocks / is-blocked-by / relates-to)

tools.name: get_projects
tools.description: List available projects to verify the project key

tools.name: get_sprints
tools.description: List sprints on a board to assign issues to the correct sprint

tools.name: create_sprint
tools.description: Create a new sprint with start and end dates matching the Scheduler's calendar

tools.name: move_to_sprint
tools.description: Move issues into a sprint for sprint planning

tools.name: create_version
tools.description: Create a release version to track milestones and release targets

use_cases: Create epics for each workstream from the requirements document
Create stories and tasks under epics matching the Work Breakdown Structure
Set story points and priorities from the Task Decomposer and Resource Allocator outputs
Link issues with blocks/is-blocked-by relationships from the dependency graph
Create and populate sprints matching the Scheduler's calendar
Create release versions for major milestones
Apply labels for workstream, complexity, and skill requirements
team_integration: The Integration Planner activates this server in Phase 6 when CONFIG.local.md specifies task_management: jira. It creates the hierarchical issue structure (epics > stories > tasks) matching the WBS, links dependencies, populates sprints, and creates release versions for milestones. The Jira board type (scrum or kanban) is set per jira_settings.board_type in CONFIG.

JIRA_API_TOKEN.description: API token for Jira Cloud authentication
JIRA_API_TOKEN.how_to_get: id.atlassian.com > Security > API tokens > Create API token

JIRA_DOMAIN.how_to_get: The subdomain of your Jira instance (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net)

JIRA_EMAIL.description: Email address associated with the Jira account
JIRA_EMAIL.how_to_get: The email used to log in to your Atlassian account
